nodes.bodyText: Creating an empty container and then PUTting nothing is not disallowed.
Pairtrees are no longer a thing
Should this test be re-tooled for "ghost nodes"?
We have a test of GhostNodes here (https://github.com/fcrepo/fcrepo/blob/main/fcrepo-http-api/src/test/java/org/fcrepo/integration/http/api/FedoraLdpIT.java#L4946) which I think covers this.
Actually that test tries to create at the ghost node. I'll add an attempt to just POST to the ghost node.
CREATED_BY and LAST_MODIFIED_BY are not produced with an actual user set. Those types of tests are done in fcrepo-auth-webac
Creating an empty container and then PUTting nothing is not disallowed.
This test has been here and ignored for 6 (I think) years, time to let it go
Jersey seems to clean these up as the @PathParam externalPath; does not show the double slash.
Actually, the HttpClient is where the clean-up happens. We should keep this test with the addition of some configuration like: #1798 (comment)
We don't (and won't) update the Last-Modified date of the object when a new membership property appears. This will however update the ETag.
Should we remove the @Ignore since FCREPO-3541 has been resolved?
I can't remove this one as eTags for membership has not been resolved. But I can remove the one above
